message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $1,000,000. This is a great price, considering the value it offers. I'm confident it will be a valuable asset to your business.
I appreciate your offer, but I'm not willing to pay $1,000,000. I'm willing to pay $900,000 for the product. I believe it's a fair price considering its value.
Bob, I appreciate your offer, but $900,000 is still too low for me. I'm willing to come down to $950,000, which is a fair compromise.  Let's try to reach an agreement.
I understand that you're willing to compromise, but $950,000 is still above my budget. I'm willing to pay $920,000 for the product. I think it's a fair price considering the value it offers.

Bob, I'm still not quite there.  $920,000 is closer, but I need to be closer to $950,000 to make this work. How about we split the difference and meet at $935,000? I believe this is a fair price considering the value of the product.

I understand your desire to meet in the middle, but I'm still not comfortable with $935,000. I'm willing to pay $915,000 for the product. I think it's a fair price considering the value it offers, and I'm willing to compromise further.

Bob, I'm not willing to go any lower than $925,000. This is a very fair price, and it's the best I can do. If you're serious about buying this product, I'm hoping we can reach an agreement on this price.

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $925,000 is still above my budget. I'm willing to pay $900,000 for the product. I think it's a fair price considering the value it offers, and I'm willing to make one more concession.
